revised_title: Investigation of Long Range Alpha-Particles from Thorium C and Radium C using Expansion Chamber
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using an expansion chamber to investigate the ranges of long-range alpha-particles from thorium C and radium C. They found that the expansion chamber provided more accurate range measurements than the scintillation method, and that it could distinguish between alpha-particles and other particles, such as protons. The results supported recent theories about the ranges of alpha-particle groups emitted by radioactive substances.
